intro: Pedicularis oligantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
